titles: Decus & tutamen, or, Our new money as now coined in full weight and fineness proved to be for the honour, safety and advantage of England, written by way of answer to Sir Richard Temple and Dr. Barbon ; to which is added an essay to preserve our new money from being hoarded, melted down, transported or counterfeited.
author: E. H.
notes: Reproduction of original in British Library.
keywords: Barbon, Nicholas, d. 1698. --  Discourse concerning coining the new money lighter.
